page.title: 13PLODDY HOUSE _ARABLE FARMING
page.content: PLODDY HOUSE - ARABLE FARMING Ploddy House is another arable farm typical of the area. It is 200 acres in size and has been owned by the Davison family for 21 years. When they bought the farm they paid Â£31,200. Mr. Davisons day begins at 7.30 a.m. when he gets up, has breakfast, reads any post and the papers making a special note of the weather over the next few days. He checks to see what his workers are planning to do that day and then plans the next day. The rest of his working day is spent checking around the farm for any problems, checking the crops for pests or diseases and as we discovered much of his day is spent answering the phone.
